title.narrative: 1.4 KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT

description.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygiene especially for the most deprived communities, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Maternal And Newborn Health, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 1: Mother and child survival, growth and development Programme Component Results (PCR) 3: Adolescent participation and empowerment

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: To address nutrition needs of children, especially the most vulnerable, the Comprehensive National Nutrition Survey (CNNS) data collection was completed in 15 states, two vital nutrition reports were published, and an online nutrition dashboard which generates visual representations of key nutrition indicators at district, state and national level was developed. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:14/01/2018

title.narrative: No. of media partners and civil society organizations which can leverage data, evidence, information and knowledge on maternal and child nutrition to influence political views and public opinion

No. of independent national organizations with technical and managerial capacity to undertake large-scale nutrition surveys and analyse and disseminate data, evidence, information and knowledge to guide inclusive multi-sectoral food and nutrition policy and programme action
No. of states with appropriate institutional mechanisms to guide and coordinate inclusive multi- sectoral food and nutrition policy and programme action, particularly for the most deprived children
No. of states with appropriate information systems to generate data and knowledge to guide inclusive multi-sectoral food and nutrition action
